text.section: This section does not apply to a compensable hernia.

If a covered employee is injured or dies due to an accidental personal injury, oral or written notice shall be given to the employer:
for injury, within 10 days after the accidental personal injury; or
for death, within 30 days after the death.

If the notice given under subsection (b) of this section is in writing, the notice shall:
state the name and address of the covered employee;
state, in plain language, the time, place, nature, and cause of the accidental personal injury; and
be signed:
for injury, by the covered employee or by an individual on behalf of the covered employee; or
for death, by at least 1 dependent of the covered employee or by an individual on behalf of the dependents of the covered employee.
Unless excused by the Commission under § 9-706 of this subtitle, failure to give notice bars a claim under this title.
